meanings.definition: The state or quality of being timid or fearful.
meanings.sent1: Her timorousnesses were evident as she hesitated to enter the dark room.
meanings.sent2: His timorousnesses often held him back from trying new things.
meanings.sent3: The kitten's timorousnesses towards the vacuum cleaner was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The timorousnesses of the mouse made it an easy target for the cat.
meanings.sent5: The timorousnesses of the young deer in the forest added to its charm.

meanings.definition: The act of showing fear or nervousness.
meanings.sent1: The timorousnesses in her voice revealed her unease.
meanings.sent2: His timorousnesses were evident in the way he fidgeted during the presentation.
meanings.sent3: The timorousnesses of the puppy around strangers was endearing.
meanings.sent4: The timorousnesses of the storm clouds warned of an impending downpour.
meanings.sent5: The timorousnesses of the child facing the dentist were palpable.

meanings.definition: A feeling of apprehension or lack of confidence.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't shake off the timorousnesses she felt before the exam.
meanings.sent2: His timorousnesses about public speaking made him avoid presentations.
meanings.sent3: The timorousnesses she felt about the upcoming party seemed irrational.
meanings.sent4: The timorousnesses in his heart hindered him from taking risks.
meanings.sent5: The timorousnesses in her mind clouded her judgment.
